dialogs.text: All these long years of trading at sea...
How many countries have I visited, how many goods have I brought and sold? This is not just a job — it's a life that flows through me with every new voyage.
But every time I look at the horizons, I feel the world becoming a little smaller. And again, a new path, new ports.
Perhaps this trip will be like all the previous ones. Maybe even better.
A life of a merchant on a ship is a constant journey from one port to another. Each voyage, like a new stage...
But I never thought that one day this journey would lead me to such an end. The winds have always been my allies, and the sea — an unknown, but familiar friend.
Everyone on deck! A storm is coming, prepare for the worst!
The clouds began to gather, and the air became heavy. At first, it was just occasional lightning strikes on the horizon, but now...
We didn’t expect the storm to be so powerful. The dark clouds began to cover the sun, and the sea seemed to go mad, showing no mercy.
I’ve never seen anything like it.
What’s happening? Why can't the captain deal with this? Will we be safe?
The captain can’t control the elements. If this storm doesn’t swallow us, the rocks on the horizon will definitely do their job.
Lightning struck so close that I felt as if the ocean itself was about to swallow us. I felt the ship jerk, and at that moment, I realized — we won’t make it.
The last thing I remember is the strike that tore everything apart. Water rushed into the cabin, and then darkness consumed me.
I’m alive... How did I survive? Where is everyone else? I must find answers before this place consumes me, just like it did with my ship.
